result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven J Spinelli was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 170 days sentence credit.
Consecutive to: Case 15CF1454.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.
Cash bail applied to Court Costs - PAID IN FULL.  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Town of Mukwonago Police Department.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Attend Victim Impact Panel.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Defendant Steven J Spinelli in court, in custody, with attorney David P. Geraghty.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1
IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

5 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 170 days) Consecutive to 15CF1454.
  -  2 YEARS 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

DL REVOCATION: 36 MONTHS.
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Attend Victim Impact Panel.

FINE  $1569.00 (apply cash bail);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (apply cash bail);

BLOOD DRAW FEE: $35.00 (apply cash bail and balance to be refunded to the poster to be forwarded to Town of Mukowonago Police Department).

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Filed by Sentencing Mitigation, LLC.
From Atty Geraghty dated 5/13/16 with attached reports.
Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
3rd amended.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven J Spinelli in court, in custody, with attorney David P. Geraghty.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 of the third amended information.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in and Count #3 is dismissed by operation of law.  The Court revokes bail and schedules sentencing in about 30 days.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Steven J Spinelli in court, in custody, with attorney David P. Geraghty.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Craig Ketola from the Town of Mukwonago Police Department, sworn in and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Geraghty. Exhibit #1 Defendant's drivers record marked and received by the Court. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. State moves for bind over and provides closing statements. Atty. Geraghty requests to dismiss and provides closing statements.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven J Spinelli in court.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant indicates he has an attorney.
